intro: Clusia radicans, commonly known as the rubber plant, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is native to Central and South America. It is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree that can grow up to 10 meters tall, characterized by its thick, waxy leaves and milky sap. The plant produces small, inconspicuous greenish-yellow flowers followed by orange or red berries. Its leaves are typically broad, elliptical, and have a glossy surface, which helps in photosynthesis in low-light conditions. Clusia radicans is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its aesthetic appeal and adaptability to various growing environments.
